properties.description: Appendicolith at the base of appendix

properties.author: Dr. Smith, ED Attending
properties.text: 45-year-old female presenting with 2-day history of progressive right lower quadrant abdominal pain. Pain started periumbilically and migrated to RLQ. Associated with nausea, anorexia, and low-grade fever. No vomiting or diarrhea. Physical exam reveals RLQ tenderness with rebound and guarding. Rovsing sign positive. Labs show leukocytosis and elevated CRP. CT scan confirms acute appendicitis with periappendiceal inflammation. Surgical consult placed.

properties.text: Surgical consent obtained for laparoscopic appendectomy

properties.author: Dr. Johnson, Surgery
properties.text: Admitting patient for laparoscopic appendectomy. Patient is a 45-year-old female with acute appendicitis confirmed on CT imaging. Pre-operative labs within normal limits. Patient consented for surgery. NPO since midnight. IV antibiotics initiated.
properties.excerpt: Admitting patient for laparoscopic appendectomy. Patient is a 45-year-old female with acute appendicitis confirmed on CT imaging. Pre-operative labs within normal limits. Patient consented for surgery...

properties.name: Laparoscopic appendectomy
properties.outcome: Successful removal of inflamed appendix, no complications

properties.text: Incision sites clean, dry, and healing well. No signs of infection.
Minimal incisional pain, well controlled with acetaminophen

properties.author: Dr. Johnson, Surgery
properties.text: Post-operative day 7 follow-up. Patient recovering well from laparoscopic appendectomy. Incisions healing nicely. Pain well controlled. Inflammatory markers normalized. Pathology confirmed acute appendicitis without perforation. Resume normal activities as tolerated. Return if fever, increasing pain, or wound concerns.

events.title: progress Note
events.summary: 45-year-old female presenting with 2-day history of progressive right lower quadrant abdominal pain. Pain started periumbilically and migrated to RLQ. Associated with nausea, anorexia, and low-grade fever. No vomiting or diarrhea. Physical exam reveals RLQ tenderness with rebound and guarding. Rovsing sign positive. Labs show leukocytosis and elevated CRP. CT scan confirms acute appendicitis with periappendiceal inflammation. Surgical consult placed.

events.summary: Admitting patient for laparoscopic appendectomy. Patient is a 45-year-old female with acute appendicitis confirmed on CT imaging. Pre-operative labs within normal limits. Patient consented for surgery. NPO since midnight. IV antibiotics initiated.

events.summary: Post-operative day 7 follow-up. Patient recovering well from laparoscopic appendectomy. Incisions healing nicely. Pain well controlled. Inflammatory markers normalized. Pathology confirmed acute appendicitis without perforation. Resume normal activities as tolerated. Return if fever, increasing pain, or wound concerns.
